data.title: Great for lunch
data.text: One of the only spots in the triangle where you can get a real deli sandwich. They also have many fantastic deli / bakery items to go. Highly recommended!

data.title: Friendly old style! Clean
data.text: Fresh sandwiches, great big pieces slices any way want them! Eat indoor or out. Easy accessible to train station.

data.title: New York style in Cary, NC
data.text: The bread, the food- just like stepping into a New York bakery!  Fantastic Pizza too!  Plus it offers all the condiments found in New York.

data.title: Great Thick Crust Pizza
data.text: We stopped in for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised by the delicious thick crust pizza and desserts made in-house. The friendly staff and reasonable prices will ensure our return to try some of the sandwiches on their menu.

data.title: Upstate NY, Italian bakery and luncheonette.
data.text:
Very best Italian bread in all of NC! Awesome sheet pizzas and sub sandwiches too. Great place for lunch, monday thru saturday!! 

Ownership/mgmt top shelf, visit there regularly. Guarantee satisfaction!

data.title: Great pizza sheets!
data.text: Casual atmosphere with lots of people stopping in for take-out.  Easy to find a table and the place was not loud.   This is a local place where things are quiet on week-ends, but lunches are busy during the week.   We love the pizza and got a sausage and green pepper 1/2 sheet.   That's right, they do not sell circular pies but sheets.   And, the quality is great.

data.title: Pretty good pizza but nothing special
data.text:
Ate here based on TripAdvisor review. First this is a fairly plain place with little atmosphere.   Menu is on a blackboard and you order at the counter.  Got two slices of pizza and it was pretty good but not great.  However one of the slices had mushrooms and they were canned (good quality) where I prefer fresh.  The lunch special of two slices a pizza and a drink for five and a half dollars is a good value so you can eat here cheap.

The people that run the place were real nice.  The question is do you give a place like this 5 stars the same as fine dining restaurants when they have a limited menu and served canned mushrooms and don't have wait staff?  Overall just an average pizza place in a little strip shopping center right next to the railroad tracks.

data.title: You get enough to eat here and even take some with you
data.text: This is a good size restaurant ,when you walk thru the door you are greeted and told to pick the place you would like to sit.So there was 3 of us we decided to sit by the candle light lights they had which was wonderful .Our drink order was out in about 3 minutes and the waitress was real friendly took our order which came with salsads and she came back with large lates of salads.Each one of us had an Italian dish which was so good I as another one of us had to get to go boxes to take ours home the place is very clean .The restrooms are very clean as the parking lot is too .Plenty of handicap parking and a wheel chair ramp provided to get handicap people in.This place is better handicap equipped than any restaurant I have seen .I will go back this is a great lace to relax and have a great meal.

data.title: The Best Stop on the Tracks
data.text: Best quick sandwiches in downtown Cary.  When I have a craving for Italian this is a must stop!  Sometimes parking is packed, so try around the corner for easier access.

data.title: Best Italian bread and subs in the South!
data.text: We have been coming to this restaurant for years!  I'm from NY so good Italian bread is hard to find, but they make daily and its delicious!  They also have 2 slices of pizza and drink specials that are amazing.  My favorite is the turkey sub! Kids come home from college and this is their first stop!  Full sheet pizza is huge and delicious too!

data.title: Aaah, spiedies outside of Binghamton, NY
data.text: Having a summer residence on Mayo Lake in NC, and originally from the triple cities of  NY, we heard about Roma's Bakery opening a restaurant in Cary, NC. Wow, we thought, tracked it down, made the 90 min. trek to Cary. We were not disappointed, Spiedies almost like home... 95% as good as what we remember... Oh yes, friendly staff, resonable prices, and a taste of home. We'll make the trip to Cary a regular outing while we're in NC. It's worth the adventure.

data.title: Friday Night Pizza Night!
data.text:
I grew up eating Roma's pizza and Lupo's spiedies in Endicott, NY.  I was thrilled when Roma's opened in Cary years ago.  Our family loves eating a sheet pizza every Friday night.  The subs and spiedies are excellent.  Their breakfast pizza is yummy too.  The people who work there are very polite and accommodating.  They have great lunch deals for adults and Cary High students.  If you're looking for a casual place to eat lunch or dinner, you should head to Roma's!  Oh, and they cater too!

P.S. I loved seeing the posters of Binghamton on the walls ... it reminded me of home.

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: We love their pizza and subs - great family place and very reasonable for good food. Our favorite is a sausage and chicken speedy pizza. The full sheet has been plenty for 2 families with small kids to share.

data.title: Little Hole in the Wall is a GEM!
data.text: This little hole in the wall is a true gem. All the food is very fresh and tastes just like back home. Great selection of Italian cookies. Rainbow cookies are my fav!! Workers are always very pleasant.

data.title: Love It
data.text: Staff if very friendly. The always take care of me. Its all about the itialian on white!

data.title: Fantastic
data.text:
My family and I were in town for a few days. We were recommended to this place for lunch by the hotel we were staying at. This place has excellent sandwhiches and even better conollis. YUM!!! 

Very friendly staff too!!
